intro: Lepidocupania subfalcata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cupuaçu, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Amazon rainforest of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. Its flowers are small and yellowish, typically arranged in clusters. The fruit, which is a capsule, contains seeds that are used in traditional medicine and as a source of nutrients.
